TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataGridDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BaseDataListDesigner

Docs.summary: Extends design-time behavior for the Web server control.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to extend the DataGridDesigner class. The code overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataGridDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to customize the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.CellPadding%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderWidth%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderColor%2A> properties when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control is rendered on a design surface.
[!code-vb[DataListDesigner_Sample2#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.design.w_5_1.vb)]
The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute> attribute to associate the designer with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
[!code-vb[DataListDesigner_Sample2#5](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.design.w_5_2.vb)]

To support template editing expose template data in the TemplateGroups property and call SetViewFlags(ViewFlags.TemplateEditing, true). http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202")

Docs.summary: Creates a template editing frame using the specified verb.

.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

Docs.param: to release both the managed and unmanaged resources; to release only the unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the object and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, the Dispose method releases all the resources held by the managed objects that this <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataGridDesigner> object references.

To support template editing expose template data in the TemplateGroups property and call SetViewFlags(ViewFlags.TemplateEditing, true). http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202")

MemberSignature.Value: public override string GetDesignTimeHtml ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the HTML markup used to represent the control at design time.
Docs.returns: The HTML markup that is used to represent the control at design time.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the GetDesignTimeHtml method to alter the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control on the design surface.
The code uses `Try...Catch...Finally` syntax to do the following:
- The `Try` section changes the values of the properties of the data grid control.
- The `Catch` section catches any exceptions and sends them to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataGridDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method.
- The `Finally` section sets the properties to their original values.
This example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataGridDesigner> class.
[!code-vb[DataListDesigner_Sample2#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.design.w_8_1.vb)]

Docs.returns: The HTML markup used to represent an empty template-based control at design time.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override string GetErrorDesignTimeHtml (Exception e);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetErrorDesignTimeHtml(class System.Exception e) cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the HTML markup displayed at design time for the specified exception when an error has been encountered while rendering the control.
Docs.returns: The HTML markup displayed at design time for the specified exception.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the GetErrorDesignTimeHtml method to modify the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control on the design surface when an exception occurs.
This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataGridDesigner> class.
[!code-vb[DataListDesigner_Sample2#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/f69324b7-fbec-4e22-8e2f-_1.vb)]

This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataGridDesigner> class.
